hypothesis_content.title: Crypto Sector ETF Pairs Mean Reversion in Neutral Regime
hypothesis_content.statement: During NEUTRAL regimes (confidence > 60%), when the 20-day z-score of the price ratio between a DeFi-focused token (e.g., UNI) and a Layer-1 token (e.g., SOL) exceeds ±2.0 standard deviations, a pairs trade (long underperformer/short outperformer) will generate a positive risk-adjusted return over the subsequent 5 trading days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Neutral regimes are characterized by range-bound, low-trend markets where sector rotation and mean reversion are dominant. DeFi and L1 tokens represent correlated but distinct crypto sub-sectors. Extreme divergences are likely driven by transient liquidity or sentiment, not fundamental re-rating, in a non-trending environment.
entry_conditions: 20-day rolling z-score of UNI/SOL price ratio crosses above +2.0 (enter: short UNI, long SOL)
20-day rolling z-score of UNI/SOL price ratio crosses below -2.0 (enter: long UNI, short SOL)
hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Median 5-day return of the strategy is not statistically greater than zero (p > 0.05) after accounting for transaction costs and funding rates (for perpetual futures).
